Ron Heaton
2025-08-01T20:14:01+00:00
Travelers Campground
Alachua FL RV Park
VIEW OUR NEW LOW RATES!
A turn off I-75 brings you to Travelers Campground, an Alachua FL RV Park!
With updated amenities, complimentary Wi-Fi and Cable, a friendly and 24/7 helpful staff, and rescue animals, you will find Travelers Campground to be your home away from home. We have a spacious and well-designed park, we are pet-friendly and offer full-hookup 30 and 50 amp service. Conveniently located on Interstate 75 near Gainesville, Florida.
Only a short drive away from the University of Florida on I-75 (exit 399), and its many fantastic venues including the Shands Cancer Center and the University of Florida Veterinary Hospital.
Travelers Campground
Park Booking/Cancellation/Safety Policies
Click to learn more about park/cancellation/pet/safety policies…
Park Policies
Travelers Campground Rates
Rates are for up to 4 people. Additional fees may apply for each person over 4.
Monthly Rates
MONTHLY SITES
One-Month Special – $999
Includes all basic utilities. For single month stays only.
Deposit is applied at check-in.
REGULAR SITES – SHORT TERM
Starting at $899 + electric*
2 – 3 Months
REGULAR SITES – LONG TERM
Starting at $799 + electric*
4 Months or more
PREMIUM SITES
Starting at $999 + electric*
LAST MONTH DEPOSIT
$300 deposit required to hold any RV site.
Applied to final month.
*Electric is metered at 16¢ per kilowatt hour
NIGHTLY/WEEKLY RATES
Nightly and Weekly rates are subject to change.
Click here to check rates and availability.
– Management reserves the right to update prices and change site assignments based on the operational needs of the park (except for 3+ month reservations with confirmed guaranteed sites).
– Discount clubs accepted on nightly rate only.
– No refunds for early departure.
– All guests are expected to follow all park rules and be courteous and respectful to guests / staff.
See
park policies
for details.

EASY IN & OUT

FRIENDLY & HELPFUL STAFF & MUCH MORE!
Visit Travelers Campground Today! Alachua FL RV Park
Map this location/Navigate to our park…
Get Directions
Travelers Campground Fun Facts
With the University of Florida only 25 minutes away – Traveler’s is a favorite for students, family, and football fans alike.
Traveler’s is home to over a dozen rescue farm animals and exotic birds. While exploring our campground keep an eye out for macaws, pigs, horses, emus, donkeys, chickens, goats, cows and more. See our office staff for a souvenir scavenger hunt and animal snacks.
It’s no secret we love animals so don’t leave the dogs at home. Bring them along to play in our spacious dog park and make use of several clean up stations across the park for your convenience.
Alachua county is where nature and culture meet. Adventure-junkies can find 5 state parks and over 6 popular swimming holes all less than a half-hour away. Kayak the pristine Ichetucknee River or float around the popular Ginnie Springs. See wild bison and gigantic alligators at Payne’s Prairie Preserve.

Breezy Oaks
RV Park
Learn More
Alachua FL RV Park Reviews
Here’s what our happy campers have to say about our park:
Excellent Dog-Friendly RV Resort! The dog park here is huge and filled with obstacles to play on. In it is also a dog wash station. You’ll have to bring your own water bottles to give “Fido” a drink from, but otherwise it’s one of the nicest dog runs we’ve seen at an RV park. The RV park itself is very well maintained, restrooms clean, sites level and paved and long enough for a tow vehicle. It’s super easy access to I-75, but sheltered enough that you don’t hear road noise. We enjoyed our 2 night stop over very much.
Marie L
,
From TripAdvisor
Excellent customer service! We stayed at this campground for two weeks. The campground staff, including store, registration, and maintenance, was very helpful and accommodating. There were interesting animals living in the park – an emu, two donkeys, a pot-bellied pig, a horse, a cow, and 6 beautiful macaws. Most were rescues. All of the park was clean and well maintained. It was close to Gainesville and shopping, restaurants, etc. I would definitely recommend it to other campers.
J.R.
,
From TripAdvisor
Highly recommend! Traveling home with our camper, 3 kids, and our dog and our truck broke down on the highway. After getting a tow truck we called Travelers Campground and they told us they would stay late to help us get set up. They greeted us at the front and led us in to our sight. Vicki and Charles made sure we had everything we needed that night. Knowing our vehicle was in the shop Vicki showed up the next morning with breakfast for our family. The kids were thrilled! They also offered to take us to the store on their day off. The property is beautiful! In the back they even have some animals that the kids loved to go visit. Some goats, horses, donkey, & birds! They have a large fenced in area for dogs to play too. We can’t thank them enough for their kind and wonderful hospitality in our time of need. We will be back!
Haylie T
,
From Facebook
We loved this place! Spacious, clean bathhouses with plenty of hot water, new washer and dryer in the laundry area. Pool was great and all of the wonderful animals were just fantastic and they kept the park immaculate. You can tell that the owners bend over backwards to make this place a really welcoming place — down to details like good directional signs, and free popcorn and coffee in the front office. I can’t think of one thing I didn’t like. We had three little ones who are already asking to come back again. I wish we could stay longer!!!
A.R.
,
From Facebook
Starting our “meander” from central FL to the Outer Banks of NC, stopped here for a few days of R&R after packing up for the summer. Lovely place, very quiet, pretty rolling hills and animals everywhere. Everyone is very friendly and helpful. When the young man lead us to our site, he waited until I hooked up the electric to make sure everything was working properly; I’ve stayed in MANY RV parks never had that happen before!
Mike K
,
From Facebook
Our very first stay ever in an RV park. Just got a travel trailer and this was a great stay. Loved the scenery and the animals especially the Hyacinth MaCaws!!!
Peter S
,
From Good Sam
We just want to give a great big “THANK YOU” to all the staff at Traveler’s Campground for being so kind and supportive to us while our granddaughter was at the UF Health Congenital Heart Center. Anyway you all could help us, you did. We always felt safe and secure at the park. Our little heart warrior is home now and doing well. I suspect we will be going back to Gainesville for checkups in the future. Traveler’s Campground will be our home base for camping while there. Again, you all are the BEST. Thank you from a Heart Warrior Grandparent!
Marie L
,
From TripAdvisor
Reserve Your Stay With Us Today!
Give us a call to book your stay with Travelers Campground…
386-462-2505
